Class BoardRackPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BoardRackPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class is responsible for drawing the game board, rack, and tiles
    Author:
    Zach
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isGrabbedTileWithinGameArea

        public boolean isGrabbedTileWithinGameArea(int x,
                                  int y)
        Determines if the given coordinate (relative to the panel) is within the game area (rack + board). This method assumes that a tile is currently grabbed by the player, which means this point (the mouse position) will be in the middle of the tile. Thus, this method makes sure that the entire tile with center x,y is within the game bounds.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the point
        y - Y position of the point
        Returns:
        Whether or not the tile is within the game area

      • getClickedCell

        public Cell getClickedCell(int x,
                  int y)
        Retrieves the Cell of the board at mouse click x,y
        Parameters:

        y - Y position of the point
        Returns:

      • getClickedTile

        public Tile getClickedTile(int x,
                  int y)
        Retrieves the tile on either the board or the rack where the mouse was clicked
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the point
        y - Y position of the point
        Returns:
        The tile at position x,y

      • getRackIndex

        public int getRackIndex(int x,
               int y)
        Retrieves the index into the array of tiles on the rack coinciding with a mouse click at x,y. This is used to determine where to insert a tile when the user drags one onto the rack. The middle of each tile is used as the horizontal boundaries--so for example, if the x,y is between the halfway point of the tile at index 1 and the tile at index 2, the method will return 2.
        Parameters:
        x - X position of the point
        y - Y position of the point
        Returns:
        Index into the tile array of the rack
